div.l: In purpose he was to make hīm his eir͗e
Both of his Catell and of his mesuage
And strange he made it for his mariage
His purpose was for to be stowe hir hie
Into som worthi blode of auncetrye
For holi chirch blode most be dispended
On holi chirch blode þat is desended
Þerefore he wold his holi blode honour͗e
Þough that þe holi chirch shuld deuour͗e
Grete haunte hath þe myller oute of doute
Of whete and malt of al þe londe aboute
And namly þer͗e was a grete collage
Men called þe Seler hall of Cambrige
Þer͗e was þere whete and eke þeir͗e malt I grounde
And eke on a day it happeth in a stounde
Seke lai þe manciple in a malady
Men went wisly he shuld die
For which þis myller͗e stale both mele and corn̄e
A hundreth tymes more þan beforne
For þere before he stale but curteysly
But now he was a thef oute ragiously
For which þe wardeyn chid and made far͗e
But þer͗eof set þe myller͗e not a tar͗e
He craked boste and seid it is not so
Þan wer͗e þer͗e yong pouer scolers two
Þat dwelled in þe hall of which I sey
Testyf þey wer͗e and lusti to pley
And only for þeir͗e myrth and reuelry
Vnto þe wardeyn̄ besely þei crie
Go geue theim leue but a litil stonde
To go to myll and se þeir͗e corn̄ grounde
And hardly þei durst ley þeir͗e nek
Þe myller shuld not stele from hem half a pek
Of corn̄ be slight ne bi force þeim reue
And atte laste þe wardein gaf þeim leve
Iohn hight þat one and Aleyn hiȝt þat oth̉er
Of one towne were þei born̄ þat hight Strother͗e
Ferr͗e in þe north I know not wher͗e
Þis Aleyn maketh al redy his ger͗e
And on an horse þe sak he cast anone
Fotth goeth Aleyn̄ þe clerk and eke Iohn
With gode swerdes and bokeler͗e be þeir͗e side
Iohn knew þe wey he nedeth not a gide
